speaker: SUFFOLK
text_entry: Henry is youthful and will quickly yield.

speaker: SUFFOLK
text_entry: Madam, I have a secret to reveal.

speaker: MARGARET
text_entry: What though I be enthralld? he seems a knight,

speaker: MARGARET
text_entry: And will not any way dishonour me.

speaker: SUFFOLK
text_entry: Lady, vouchsafe to listen what I say.

speaker: MARGARET
text_entry: Perhaps I shall be rescued by the French;

speaker: MARGARET
text_entry: And then I need not crave his courtesy.

speaker: SUFFOLK
text_entry: Sweet madam, give me a hearing in a cause--

speaker: MARGARET
text_entry: Tush, women have been captivate ere now.

speaker: SUFFOLK
text_entry: Lady, wherefore talk you so?

speaker: MARGARET
text_entry: I cry you mercy, tis but Quid for Quo.

speaker: SUFFOLK
text_entry: Say, gentle princess, would you not suppose

speaker: SUFFOLK
text_entry: Your bondage happy, to be made a queen?

speaker: MARGARET
text_entry: To be a queen in bondage is more vile

speaker: MARGARET
text_entry: Than is a slave in base servility;

speaker: MARGARET
text_entry: For princes should be free.

speaker: SUFFOLK
text_entry: And so shall you,

speaker: SUFFOLK
text_entry: If happy Englands royal king be free.

speaker: MARGARET
text_entry: Why, what concerns his freedom unto me?

speaker: SUFFOLK
text_entry: Ill undertake to make thee Henrys queen,

speaker: SUFFOLK
text_entry: To put a golden sceptre in thy hand

speaker: SUFFOLK
text_entry: And set a precious crown upon thy head,

speaker: SUFFOLK
text_entry: If thou wilt condescend to be my--

speaker: MARGARET
text_entry: What?

speaker: SUFFOLK
text_entry: His love.

speaker: MARGARET
text_entry: I am unworthy to be Henrys wife.

speaker: SUFFOLK
text_entry: No, gentle madam; I unworthy am

speaker: SUFFOLK
text_entry: To woo so fair a dame to be his wife,

speaker: SUFFOLK
text_entry: And have no portion in the choice myself.

speaker: SUFFOLK
text_entry: How say you, madam, are ye so content?

speaker: MARGARET
text_entry: An if my father please, I am content.

speaker: SUFFOLK
text_entry: Then call our captains and our colours forth.

speaker: SUFFOLK
text_entry: And, madam, at your fathers castle walls

speaker: SUFFOLK
text_entry: Well crave a parley, to confer with him.

speaker: SUFFOLK
text_entry: A parley sounded. Enter REIGNIER on the walls

speaker: SUFFOLK
text_entry: See, Reignier, see, thy daughter prisoner!

speaker: REIGNIER
text_entry: To whom?

speaker: SUFFOLK
text_entry: To me.

speaker: REIGNIER
text_entry: Suffolk, what remedy?

speaker: REIGNIER
text_entry: I am a soldier, and unapt to weep,

speaker: REIGNIER
text_entry: Or to exclaim on fortunes fickleness.

speaker: SU FFOLK
text_entry: Yes, there is remedy enough, my lord:

speaker: SU FFOLK
text_entry: Consent, and for thy honour give consent,

speaker: SU FFOLK
text_entry: Thy daughter shall be wedded to my king;

speaker: SU FFOLK
text_entry: Whom I with pain have wood and won thereto;

speaker: SU FFOLK
text_entry: And this her easy-held imprisonment

speaker: SU FFOLK
text_entry: Hath gained thy daughter princely liberty.

speaker: REIGNIER
text_entry: Speaks Suffolk as he thinks?

speaker: SUFFOLK
text_entry: Fair Margaret knows

speaker: SUFFOLK
text_entry: That Suffolk doth not flatter, face, or feign.

speaker: REIGNIER
text_entry: Upon thy princely warrant, I descend

speaker: REIGNIER
text_entry: To give thee answer of thy just demand.

speaker: REIGNIER
text_entry: Exit from the walls

speaker: SUFFOLK
text_entry: And here I will expect thy coming.

speaker: SUFFOLK
text_entry: Trumpets sound. Enter REIGNIER, below

speaker: REIGNIER
text_entry: Welcome, brave earl, into our territories:

speaker: REIGNIER
text_entry: Command in Anjou what your honour pleases.

speaker: SUFFOLK
text_entry: Thanks, Reignier, happy for so sweet a child,

speaker: SUFFOLK
text_entry: Fit to be made companion with a king:

speaker: SUFFOLK
text_entry: What answer makes your grace unto my suit?

speaker: REIGNIER
text_entry: Since thou dost deign to woo her little worth

speaker: REIGNIER
text_entry: To be the princely bride of such a lord;

speaker: REIGNIER
text_entry: Upon condition I may quietly

speaker: REIGNIER
text_entry: Enjoy mine own, the country Maine and Anjou,

speaker: REIGNIER
text_entry: Free from oppression or the stroke of war,

speaker: REIGNIER
text_entry: My daughter shall be Henrys, if he please.

speaker: SUFFOLK
text_entry: That is her ransom; I deliver her;

speaker: SUFFOLK
text_entry: And those two counties I will undertake

speaker: SUFFOLK
text_entry: Your grace shall well and quietly enjoy.

speaker: REIGNIER
text_entry: And I again, in Henrys royal name,

speaker: REIGNIER
text_entry: As deputy unto that gracious king,

speaker: REIGNIER
text_entry: Give thee her hand, for sign of plighted faith.

speaker: SUFFOLK
text_entry: Reignier of France, I give thee kingly thanks,

speaker: SUFFOLK
text_entry: Because this is in traffic of a king.

speaker: SUFFOLK
text_entry: Aside

speaker: SUFFOLK
text_entry: And yet, methinks, I could be well content

speaker: SUFFOLK
text_entry: To be mine own attorney in this case.

speaker: SUFFOLK
text_entry: Ill over then to England with this news,

speaker: SUFFOLK
text_entry: And make this marriage to be solemnized.

speaker: SUFFOLK
text_entry: So farewell, Reignier: set this diamond safe

speaker: SUFFOLK
text_entry: In golden palaces, as it becomes.

speaker: REIGNIER
text_entry: I do embrace thee, as I would embrace

speaker: REIGNIER
text_entry: The Christian prince, King Henry, were he here.

speaker: MARGARET
text_entry: Farewell, my lord: good wishes, praise and prayers

speaker: MARGARET
text_entry: Shall Suffolk ever have of Margaret.

speaker: MARGARET
text_entry: Going

speaker: SUFFOLK
text_entry: Farewell, sweet madam: but hark you, Margaret;

speaker: SUFFOLK
text_entry: No princely commendations to my king?

speaker: MARGARET
text_entry: Such commendations as becomes a maid,

speaker: MARGARET
text_entry: A virgin and his servant, say to him.

speaker: SUFFOLK
text_entry: Words sweetly placed and modestly directed.

speaker: SUFFOLK
text_entry: But madam, I must trouble you again;

speaker: SUFFOLK
text_entry: No loving token to his majesty?

speaker: MARGARET
text_entry: Yes, my good lord, a pure unspotted heart,

speaker: MARGARET
text_entry: Never yet taint with love, I send the king.

speaker: SUFFOLK
text_entry: And this withal.

speaker: SUFFOLK
text_entry: Kisses her

speaker: MARGARET
text_entry: That for thyself: I will not so presume

speaker: MARGARET
text_entry: To send such peevish tokens to a king.

speaker: MARGARET
text_entry: Exeunt REIGNIER and MARGARET

speaker: SUFFOLK
text_entry: O, wert thou for myself! But, Suffolk, stay;

speaker: SUFFOLK
text_entry: Thou mayst not wander in that labyrinth;

speaker: SUFFOLK
text_entry: There Minotaurs and ugly treasons lurk.

speaker: SUFFOLK
text_entry: Solicit Henry with her wondrous praise:

speaker: SUFFOLK
text_entry: Bethink thee on her virtues that surmount,

speaker: SUFFOLK
text_entry: And natural graces that extinguish art;

speaker: SUFFOLK
text_entry: Repeat their semblance often on the seas,

speaker: SUFFOLK
text_entry: That, when thou comest to kneel at Henrys feet,

speaker: SUFFOLK
text_entry: Thou mayst bereave him of his wits with wonder.

speaker: SUFFOLK
text_entry: Exit

speaker: SUFFOLK
text_entry: SCENE IV. Camp of the YORK in Anjou.

speaker: SUFFOLK
text_entry: Enter YORK, WARWICK, and others

speaker: YORK
text_entry: Bring forth that sorceress condemnd to burn.

speaker: YORK
text_entry: Enter JOAN LA PUCELLE, guarded, and a Shepherd

speaker: Shepherd
text_entry: Ah, Joan, this kills thy fathers heart outright!

speaker: Shepherd
text_entry: Have I sought every country far and near,

speaker: Shepherd
text_entry: And, now it is my chance to find thee out,

speaker: Shepherd
text_entry: Must I behold thy timeless cruel death?

speaker: Shepherd
text_entry: Ah, Joan, sweet daughter Joan, Ill die with thee!

speaker: JOAN LA PUCELLE
text_entry: Decrepit miser! base ignoble wretch!

speaker: JOAN LA PUCELLE
text_entry: I am descended of a gentler blood:

speaker: JOAN LA PUCELLE
text_entry: Thou art no father nor no friend of mine.

speaker: Shepherd
text_entry: Out, out! My lords, an please you, tis not so;

speaker: Shepherd
text_entry: I did beget her, all the parish knows:

speaker: Shepherd
text_entry: Her mother liveth yet, can testify

speaker: Shepherd
text_entry: She was the first fruit of my bachelorship.

speaker: WARWICK
text_entry: Graceless! wilt thou deny thy parentage?

speaker: YORK
text_entry: This argues what her kind of life hath been,

speaker: YORK
text_entry: Wicked and vile; and so her death concludes.

speaker: Shepherd
text_entry: Fie, Joan, that thou wilt be so obstacle!

speaker: Shepherd
text_entry: God knows thou art a collop of my flesh;

speaker: Shepherd
text_entry: And for thy sake have I shed many a tear:

speaker: Shepherd
text_entry: Deny me not, I prithee, gentle Joan.

speaker: JOAN LA PUCELLE
text_entry: Peasant, avaunt! You have subornd this man,

speaker: JOAN LA PUCELLE
text_entry: Of purpose to obscure my noble birth.

speaker: Shepherd
text_entry: Tis true, I gave a noble to the priest

speaker: Shepherd
text_entry: The morn that I was wedded to her mother.

speaker: Shepherd
text_entry: Kneel down and take my blessing, good my girl.

speaker: Shepherd
text_entry: Wilt thou not stoop? Now cursed be the time

speaker: Shepherd
text_entry: Of thy nativity! I would the milk

speaker: Shepherd
text_entry: Thy mother gave thee when thou suckdst her breast,

speaker: Shepherd
text_entry: Had been a little ratsbane for thy sake!

speaker: Shepherd
text_entry: Or else, when thou didst keep my lambs a-field,

speaker: Shepherd
text_entry: I wish some ravenous wolf had eaten thee!

speaker: Shepherd
text_entry: Dost thou deny thy father, cursed drab?

speaker: Shepherd
text_entry: O, burn her, burn her! hanging is too good.

speaker: Shepherd
text_entry: Exit

speaker: YORK
text_entry: Take her away; for she hath lived too long,

speaker: YORK
text_entry: To fill the world with vicious qualities.

speaker: JOAN LA PUCELLE
text_entry: First, let me tell you whom you have condemnd:

speaker: JOAN LA PUCELLE
text_entry: Not me begotten of a shepherd swain,

speaker: JOAN LA PUCELLE
text_entry: But issued from the progeny of kings;

speaker: JOAN LA PUCELLE
text_entry: Virtuous and holy; chosen from above,

speaker: JOAN LA PUCELLE
text_entry: By inspiration of celestial grace,

speaker: JOAN LA PUCELLE
text_entry: To work exceeding miracles on earth.

speaker: JOAN LA PUCELLE
text_entry: I never had to do with wicked spirits:

speaker: JOAN LA PUCELLE
text_entry: But you, that are polluted with your lusts,

speaker: JOAN LA PUCELLE
text_entry: Staind with the guiltless blood of innocents,

speaker: JOAN LA PUCELLE
text_entry: Corrupt and tainted with a thousand vices,

speaker: JOAN LA PUCELLE
text_entry: Because you want the grace that others have,

speaker: JOAN LA PUCELLE
text_entry: You judge it straight a thing impossible

speaker: JOAN LA PUCELLE
text_entry: To compass wonders but by help of devils.

speaker: JOAN LA PUCELLE
text_entry: No, misconceived! Joan of Arc hath been

speaker: JOAN LA PUCELLE
text_entry: A virgin from her tender infancy,

speaker: JOAN LA PUCELLE
text_entry: Chaste and immaculate in very thought;

speaker: JOAN LA PUCELLE
text_entry: Whose maiden blood, thus rigorously effused,

speaker: JOAN LA PUCELLE
text_entry: Will cry for vengeance at the gates of heaven.

speaker: YORK
text_entry: Ay, ay: away with her to execution!

speaker: WARWICK
text_entry: And hark ye, sirs; because she is a maid,

speaker: WARWICK
text_entry: Spare for no faggots, let there be enow:

speaker: WARWICK
text_entry: Place barrels of pitch upon the fatal stake,

speaker: WARWICK
text_entry: That so her torture may be shortened.

speaker: JOAN LA PUCELLE
text_entry: Will nothing turn your unrelenting hearts?

speaker: JOAN LA PUCELLE
text_entry: Then, Joan, discover thine infirmity,

speaker: JOAN LA PUCELLE
text_entry: That warranteth by law to be thy privilege.

speaker: JOAN LA PUCELLE
text_entry: I am with child, ye bloody homicides:

speaker: JOAN LA PUCELLE
text_entry: Murder not then the fruit within my womb,

speaker: JOAN LA PUCELLE
text_entry: Although ye hale me to a violent death.

speaker: YORK
text_entry: Now heaven forfend! the holy maid with child!

speaker: WARWICK
text_entry: The greatest miracle that eer ye wrought:

speaker: WARWICK
text_entry: Is all your strict preciseness come to this?

speaker: YORK
text_entry: She and the Dauphin have been juggling:

speaker: YORK
text_entry: I did imagine what would be her refuge.

speaker: WARWICK
text_entry: Well, go to; well have no bastards live;

speaker: WARWICK
text_entry: Especially since Charles must father it.

speaker: JOAN LA PUCELLE
text_entry: You are deceived; my child is none of his:

speaker: JOAN LA PUCELLE
text_entry: It was Alencon that enjoyd my love.

speaker: YORK
text_entry: Alencon! that notorious Machiavel!

speaker: YORK
text_entry: It dies, an if it had a thousand lives.

speaker: JOAN LA PUCELLE
text_entry: O, give me leave, I have deluded you:

speaker: JOAN LA PUCELLE
text_entry: Twas neither Charles nor yet the duke I named,

speaker: JOAN LA PUCELLE
text_entry: But Reignier, king of Naples, that prevaild.

speaker: WARWICK
text_entry: A married man! thats most intolerable.

speaker: YORK
text_entry: Why, heres a girl! I think she knows not well,

speaker: YORK
text_entry: There were so many, whom she may accuse.

speaker: WARWICK
text_entry: Its sign she hath been liberal and free.

speaker: YORK
text_entry: And yet, forsooth, she is a virgin pure.

speaker: YORK
text_entry: Strumpet, thy words condemn thy brat and thee:

speaker: YORK
text_entry: Use no entreaty, for it is in vain.

speaker: JOAN LA PUCELLE
text_entry: Then lead me hence; with whom I leave my curse:

speaker: JOAN LA PUCELLE
text_entry: May never glorious sun reflex his beams

speaker: JOAN LA PUCELLE
text_entry: Upon the country where you make abode;

speaker: JOAN LA PUCELLE
text_entry: But darkness and the gloomy shade of death

speaker: JOAN LA PUCELLE
text_entry: Environ you, till mischief and despair

speaker: JOAN LA PUCELLE
text_entry: Drive you to break your necks or hang yourselves!

speaker: JOAN LA PUCELLE
text_entry: Exit, guarded

speaker: YORK
text_entry: Break thou in pieces and consume to ashes,

speaker: YORK
text_entry: Thou foul accursed minister of hell!

speaker: YORK
text_entry: Enter CARDINAL OF WINCHESTER, attended

speaker: YORK
text_entry: CARDINAL

speaker: OF WINCHESTER
text_entry: Lord regent, I do greet your excellence

speaker: OF WINCHESTER
text_entry: With letters of commission from the king.

speaker: OF WINCHESTER
text_entry: For know, my lords, the states of Christendom,

speaker: OF WINCHESTER
text_entry: Moved with remorse of these outrageous broils,

speaker: OF WINCHESTER
text_entry: Have earnestly implored a general peace

speaker: OF WINCHESTER
text_entry: Betwixt our nation and the aspiring French;

speaker: OF WINCHESTER
text_entry: And here at hand the Dauphin and his train

speaker: OF WINCHESTER
text_entry: Approacheth, to confer about some matter.

speaker: YORK
text_entry: Is all our travail turnd to this effect?

speaker: YORK
text_entry: After the slaughter of so many peers,

speaker: YORK
text_entry: So many captains, gentlemen and soldiers,

speaker: YORK
text_entry: That in this quarrel have been overthrown

speaker: YORK
text_entry: And sold their bodies for their countrys benefit,

speaker: YORK
text_entry: Shall we at last conclude effeminate peace?

speaker: YORK
text_entry: Have we not lost most part of all the towns,

speaker: YORK
text_entry: By treason, falsehood and by treachery,

speaker: YORK
text_entry: Our great progenitors had conquered?

speaker: YORK
text_entry: O Warwick, Warwick! I foresee with grief

speaker: YORK
text_entry: The utter loss of all the realm of France.

speaker: WARWICK
text_entry: Be patient, York: if we conclude a peace,

speaker: WARWICK
text_entry: It shall be with such strict and severe covenants

speaker: WARWICK
text_entry: As little shall the Frenchmen gain thereby.

speaker: WARWICK
text_entry: Enter CHARLES, ALENCON, BASTARD OF ORLEANS, REIGNIER, and others

speaker: CHARLES
text_entry: Since, lords of England, it is thus agreed

speaker: CHARLES
text_entry: That peaceful truce shall be proclaimd in France,

speaker: CHARLES
text_entry: We come to be informed by yourselves

speaker: CHARLES
text_entry: What the conditions of that league must be.

speaker: YORK
text_entry: Speak, Winchester; for boiling choler chokes

speaker: YORK
text_entry: The hollow passage of my poisond voice,

speaker: YORK
text_entry: By sight of these our baleful enemies.

speaker: YORK
text_entry: CARDINAL

speaker: OF WINCHESTER
text_entry: Charles, and the rest, it is enacted thus:

speaker: OF WINCHESTER
text_entry: That, in regard King Henry gives consent,

speaker: OF WINCHESTER
text_entry: Of mere compassion and of lenity,

speaker: OF WINCHESTER
text_entry: To ease your country of distressful war,

speaker: OF WINCHESTER
text_entry: And suffer you to breathe in fruitful peace,

speaker: OF WINCHESTER
text_entry: You shall become true liegemen to his crown:

speaker: OF WINCHESTER
text_entry: And Charles, upon condition thou wilt swear

speaker: OF WINCHESTER
text_entry: To pay him tribute, submit thyself,

speaker: OF WINCHESTER
text_entry: Thou shalt be placed as viceroy under him,

speaker: OF WINCHESTER
text_entry: And still enjoy thy regal dignity.

speaker: ALENCON
text_entry: Must he be then as shadow of himself?

speaker: ALENCON
text_entry: Adorn his temples with a coronet,

speaker: ALENCON
text_entry: And yet, in substance and authority,

speaker: ALENCON
text_entry: Retain but privilege of a private man?

speaker: ALENCON
text_entry: This proffer is absurd and reasonless.

speaker: CHARLES
text_entry: Tis known already that I am possessd

speaker: CHARLES
text_entry: With more than half the Gallian territories,

speaker: CHARLES
text_entry: And therein reverenced for their lawful king:

speaker: CHARLES
text_entry: Shall I, for lucre of the rest unvanquishd,

speaker: CHARLES
text_entry: Detract so much from that prerogative,

speaker: CHARLES
text_entry: As to be calld but viceroy of the whole?

speaker: CHARLES
text_entry: No, lord ambassador, Ill rather keep

speaker: CHARLES
text_entry: That which I have than, coveting for more,

speaker: CHARLES
text_entry: Be cast from possibility of all.

speaker: YORK
text_entry: Insulting Charles! hast thou by secret means

speaker: YORK
text_entry: Used intercession to obtain a league,

speaker: YORK
text_entry: And, now the matter grows to compromise,

speaker: YORK
text_entry: Standst thou aloof upon comparison?

speaker: YORK
text_entry: Either accept the title thou usurpst,

speaker: YORK
text_entry: Of benefit proceeding from our king

speaker: YORK
text_entry: And not of any challenge of desert,

speaker: YORK
text_entry: Or we will plague thee with incessant wars.

speaker: REIGNIER
text_entry: My lord, you do not well in obstinacy

speaker: REIGNIER
text_entry: To cavil in the course of this contract:

speaker: REIGNIER
text_entry: If once it be neglected, ten to one

speaker: REIGNIER
text_entry: We shall not find like opportunity.

speaker: ALENCON
text_entry: To say the truth, it is your policy

speaker: ALENCON
text_entry: To save your subjects from such massacre

speaker: ALENCON
text_entry: And ruthless slaughters as are daily seen

speaker: ALENCON
text_entry: By our proceeding in hostility;

speaker: ALENCON
text_entry: And therefore take this compact of a truce,

speaker: ALENCON
text_entry: Although you break it when your pleasure serves.

speaker: WARWICK
text_entry: How sayst thou, Charles? shall our condition stand?

speaker: CHARLES
text_entry: It shall;

speaker: CHARLES
text_entry: Only reserved, you claim no interest

speaker: CHARLES
text_entry: In any of our towns of garrison.

speaker: YORK
text_entry: Then swear allegiance to his majesty,

speaker: YORK
text_entry: As thou art knight, never to disobey

speaker: YORK
text_entry: Nor be rebellious to the crown of England,

speaker: YORK
text_entry: Thou, nor thy nobles, to the crown of England.

speaker: YORK
text_entry: So, now dismiss your army when ye please:

speaker: YORK
text_entry: Hang up your ensign, let your drums be still,

speaker: YORK
text_entry: For here we entertain a solemn peace.

speaker: YORK
text_entry: Exeunt

speaker: YORK
text_entry: SCENE V. London. The palace.

speaker: YORK
text_entry: Enter SUFFOLK in conference with KING HENRY VI, GLOUCESTER and EXETER

speaker: KING HENRY VI
text_entry: Your wondrous rare description, noble earl,

speaker: KING HENRY VI
text_entry: Of beauteous Margaret hath astonishd me:

speaker: KING HENRY VI
text_entry: Her virtues graced with external gifts

speaker: KING HENRY VI
text_entry: Do breed loves settled passions in my heart:

speaker: KING HENRY VI
text_entry: And like as rigor of tempestuous gusts

speaker: KING HENRY VI
text_entry: Provokes the mightiest hulk against the tide,

speaker: KING HENRY VI
text_entry: So am I driven by breath of her renown

speaker: KING HENRY VI
text_entry: Either to suffer shipwreck or arrive

speaker: KING HENRY VI
text_entry: Where I may have fruition of her love.

speaker: SUFFOLK
text_entry: Tush, my good lord, this superficial tale

speaker: SUFFOLK
text_entry: Is but a preface of her worthy praise;

speaker: SUFFOLK
text_entry: The chief perfections of that lovely dame

speaker: SUFFOLK
text_entry: Had I sufficient skill to utter them,

speaker: SUFFOLK
text_entry: Would make a volume of enticing lines,

speaker: SUFFOLK
text_entry: Able to ravish any dull conceit:

speaker: SUFFOLK
text_entry: And, which is more, she is not so divine,

speaker: SUFFOLK
text_entry: So full-replete with choice of all delights,

speaker: SUFFOLK
text_entry: But with as humble lowliness of mind

speaker: SUFFOLK
text_entry: She is content to be at your command;

speaker: SUFFOLK
text_entry: Command, I mean, of virtuous chaste intents,

speaker: SUFFOLK
text_entry: To love and honour Henry as her lord.

speaker: KING HENRY VI
text_entry: And otherwise will Henry neer presume.

speaker: KING HENRY VI
text_entry: Therefore, my lord protector, give consent

speaker: KING HENRY VI
text_entry: That Margaret may be Englands royal queen.

speaker: GLOUCESTER
text_entry: So should I give consent to flatter sin.

speaker: GLOUCESTER
text_entry: You know, my lord, your highness is betrothd

speaker: GLOUCESTER
text_entry: Unto another lady of esteem:

speaker: GLOUCESTER
text_entry: How shall we then dispense with that contract,

speaker: GLOUCESTER
text_entry: And not deface your honour with reproach?

speaker: SUFFOLK
text_entry: As doth a ruler with unlawful oaths;

speaker: SUFFOLK
text_entry: Or one that, at a triumph having vowd

speaker: SUFFOLK
text_entry: To try his strength, forsaketh yet the lists

speaker: SUFFOLK
text_entry: By reason of his adversarys odds:

speaker: SUFFOLK
text_entry: A poor earls daughter is unequal odds,

speaker: SUFFOLK
text_entry: And therefore may be broke without offence.

speaker: GLOUCESTER
text_entry: Why, what, I pray, is Margaret more than that?

speaker: GLOUCESTER
text_entry: Her father is no better than an earl,

speaker: GLOUCESTER
text_entry: Although in glorious titles he excel.

speaker: SUFFOLK
text_entry: Yes, lord, her father is a king,

speaker: SUFFOLK
text_entry: The King of Naples and Jerusalem;

speaker: SUFFOLK
text_entry: And of such great authority in France

speaker: SUFFOLK
text_entry: As his alliance will confirm our peace

speaker: SUFFOLK
text_entry: And keep the Frenchmen in allegiance.

speaker: GLOUCESTER
text_entry: And so the Earl of Armagnac may do,

speaker: GLOUCESTER
text_entry: Because he is near kinsman unto Charles.

speaker: EXETER
text_entry: Beside, his wealth doth warrant a liberal dower,

speaker: EXETER
text_entry: Where Reignier sooner will receive than give.

speaker: SUFFOLK
text_entry: A dower, my lords! disgrace not so your king,

speaker: SUFFOLK
text_entry: That he should be so abject, base and poor,

speaker: SUFFOLK
text_entry: To choose for wealth and not for perfect love.

speaker: SUFFOLK
text_entry: Henry is able to enrich his queen

speaker: SUFFOLK
text_entry: And not seek a queen to make him rich:

speaker: SUFFOLK
text_entry: So worthless peasants bargain for their wives,

speaker: SUFFOLK
text_entry: As market-men for oxen, sheep, or horse.

speaker: SUFFOLK
text_entry: Marriage is a matter of more worth

speaker: SUFFOLK
text_entry: Than to be dealt in by attorneyship;

speaker: SUFFOLK
text_entry: Not whom we will, but whom his grace affects,

speaker: SUFFOLK
text_entry: Must be companion of his nuptial bed:

speaker: SUFFOLK
text_entry: And therefore, lords, since he affects her most,

speaker: SUFFOLK
text_entry: It most of all these reasons bindeth us,

speaker: SUFFOLK
text_entry: In our opinions she should be preferrd.

speaker: SUFFOLK
text_entry: For what is wedlock forced but a hell,

speaker: SUFFOLK
text_entry: An age of discord and continual strife?

speaker: SUFFOLK
text_entry: Whereas the contrary bringeth bliss,

speaker: SUFFOLK
text_entry: And is a pattern of celestial peace.

speaker: SUFFOLK
text_entry: Whom should we match with Henry, being a king,

speaker: SUFFOLK
text_entry: But Margaret, that is daughter to a king?

speaker: SUFFOLK
text_entry: Her peerless feature, joined with her birth,

speaker: SUFFOLK
text_entry: Approves her fit for none but for a king:

speaker: SUFFOLK
text_entry: Her valiant courage and undaunted spirit,

speaker: SUFFOLK
text_entry: More than in women commonly is seen,

speaker: SUFFOLK
text_entry: Will answer our hope in issue of a king;

speaker: SUFFOLK
text_entry: For Henry, son unto a conqueror,

speaker: SUFFOLK
text_entry: Is likely to beget more conquerors,

speaker: SUFFOLK
text_entry: If with a lady of so high resolve

speaker: SUFFOLK
text_entry: As is fair Margaret he be linkd in love.

speaker: SUFFOLK
text_entry: Then yield, my lords; and here conclude with me

speaker: SUFFOLK
text_entry: That Margaret shall be queen, and none but she.

speaker: KING HENRY VI
text_entry: Whether it be through force of your report,

speaker: KING HENRY VI
text_entry: My noble Lord of Suffolk, or for that

speaker: KING HENRY VI
text_entry: My tender youth was never yet attaint

speaker: KING HENRY VI
text_entry: With any passion of inflaming love,

speaker: KING HENRY VI
text_entry: I cannot tell; but this I am assured,

speaker: KING HENRY VI
text_entry: I feel such sharp dissension in my breast,

speaker: KING HENRY VI
text_entry: Such fierce alarums both of hope and fear,

speaker: KING HENRY VI
text_entry: As I am sick with working of my thoughts.

speaker: KING HENRY VI
text_entry: Take, therefore, shipping; post, my lord, to France;

speaker: KING HENRY VI
text_entry: Agree to any covenants, and procure

speaker: KING HENRY VI
text_entry: That Lady Margaret do vouchsafe to come

speaker: KING HENRY VI
text_entry: To cross the seas to England and be crownd

speaker: KING HENRY VI
text_entry: King Henrys faithful and anointed queen:

speaker: KING HENRY VI
text_entry: For your expenses and sufficient charge,

speaker: KING HENRY VI
text_entry: Among the people gather up a tenth.

speaker: KING HENRY VI
text_entry: Be gone, I say; for, till you do return,

speaker: KING HENRY VI
text_entry: I rest perplexed with a thousand cares.

speaker: KING HENRY VI
text_entry: And you, good uncle, banish all offence:

speaker: KING HENRY VI
text_entry: If you do censure me by what you were,

speaker: KING HENRY VI
text_entry: Not what you are, I know it will excuse

speaker: KING HENRY VI
text_entry: This sudden execution of my will.

speaker: KING HENRY VI
text_entry: And so, conduct me where, from company,

speaker: KING HENRY VI
text_entry: I may revolve and ruminate my grief.

speaker: KING HENRY VI
text_entry: Exit

speaker: GLOUCESTER
text_entry: Ay, grief, I fear me, both at first and last.

speaker: GLOUCESTER
text_entry: Exeunt GLOUCESTER and EXETER

speaker: SUFFOLK
text_entry: Thus Suffolk hath prevaild; and thus he goes,

speaker: SUFFOLK
text_entry: As did the youthful Paris once to Greece,

speaker: SUFFOLK
text_entry: With hope to find the like event in love,

speaker: SUFFOLK
text_entry: But prosper better than the Trojan did.

speaker: SUFFOLK
text_entry: Margaret shall now be queen, and rule the king;

speaker: SUFFOLK
text_entry: But I will rule both her, the king and realm.

speaker: SUFFOLK
text_entry: Exit

speaker: SUFFOLK
text_entry: ACT I

speaker: SUFFOLK
text_entry: SCENE I. London. The palace.

speaker: SUFFOLK
text_entry: Flourish of trumpets: then hautboys. Enter KING  HENRY VI, GLOUCESTER, SALISBURY, WARWICK, and  CARDINAL, on the one side; QUEEN MARGARET, SUFFOLK, YORK, SOMERSET, and BUCKINGHAM, on the other

speaker: SUFFOLK
text_entry: As by your high imperial majesty

speaker: SUFFOLK
text_entry: I had in charge at my depart for France,

speaker: SUFFOLK
text_entry: As procurator to your excellence,

speaker: SUFFOLK
text_entry: To marry Princess Margaret for your grace,

speaker: SUFFOLK
text_entry: So, in the famous ancient city, Tours,

speaker: SUFFOLK
text_entry: In presence of the Kings of France and Sicil,

speaker: SUFFOLK
text_entry: The Dukes of Orleans, Calaber, Bretagne and Alencon,

speaker: SUFFOLK
text_entry: Seven earls, twelve barons and twenty reverend bishops,

speaker: SUFFOLK
text_entry: I have performd my task and was espoused:

speaker: SUFFOLK
text_entry: And humbly now upon my bended knee,

speaker: SUFFOLK
text_entry: In sight of England and her lordly peers,

speaker: SUFFOLK
text_entry: Deliver up my title in the queen

speaker: SUFFOLK
text_entry: To your most gracious hands, that are the substance

speaker: SUFFOLK
text_entry: Of that great shadow I did represent;

speaker: SUFFOLK
text_entry: The happiest gift that ever marquess gave,

speaker: SUFFOLK
text_entry: The fairest queen that ever king received.

speaker: KING HENRY VI
text_entry: Suffolk, arise. Welcome, Queen Margaret:

speaker: KING HENRY VI
text_entry: I can express no kinder sign of love

speaker: KING HENRY VI
text_entry: Than this kind kiss. O Lord, that lends me life,

speaker: KING HENRY VI
text_entry: Lend me a heart replete with thankfulness!

speaker: KING HENRY VI
text_entry: For thou hast given me in this beauteous face

speaker: KING HENRY VI
text_entry: A world of earthly blessings to my soul,

speaker: KING HENRY VI
text_entry: If sympathy of love unite our thoughts.

speaker: QUEEN MARGARET
text_entry: Great King of England and my gracious lord,

speaker: QUEEN MARGARET
text_entry: The mutual conference that my mind hath had,

speaker: QUEEN MARGARET
text_entry: By day, by night, waking and in my dreams,

speaker: QUEEN MARGARET
text_entry: In courtly company or at my beads,

speaker: QUEEN MARGARET
text_entry: With you, mine alder-liefest sovereign,

speaker: QUEEN MARGARET
text_entry: Makes me the bolder to salute my king

speaker: QUEEN MARGARET
text_entry: With ruder terms, such as my wit affords

speaker: QUEEN MARGARET
text_entry: And over-joy of heart doth minister.

speaker: KING HENRY VI
text_entry: Her sight did ravish; but her grace in speech,

speaker: KING HENRY VI
text_entry: Her words y-clad with wisdoms majesty,

speaker: KING HENRY VI
text_entry: Makes me from wondering fall to weeping joys;

speaker: KING HENRY VI
text_entry: Such is the fulness of my hearts content.

speaker: KING HENRY VI
text_entry: Lords, with one cheerful voice welcome my love.

speaker: ALL
text_entry: [Kneeling]  Long live Queen Margaret, Englands

speaker: ALL
text_entry: happiness!

speaker: QUEEN MARGARET
text_entry: We thank you all.

speaker: QUEEN MARGARET
text_entry: Flourish

speaker: SUFFOLK
text_entry: My lord protector, so it please your grace,

speaker: SUFFOLK
text_entry: Here are the articles of contracted peace

speaker: SUFFOLK
text_entry: Between our sovereign and the French king Charles,

speaker: SUFFOLK
text_entry: For eighteen months concluded by consent.

speaker: GLOUCESTER
text_entry: [Reads]  Imprimis, it is agreed between the French

speaker: GLOUCESTER
text_entry: king Charles, and William de la Pole, Marquess of

speaker: GLOUCESTER
text_entry: Suffolk, ambassador for Henry King of England, that

speaker: GLOUCESTER
text_entry: the said Henry shall espouse the Lady Margaret,

speaker: GLOUCESTER
text_entry: daughter unto Reignier King of Naples, Sicilia and

speaker: GLOUCESTER
text_entry: Jerusalem, and crown her Queen of England ere the

speaker: GLOUCESTER
text_entry: thirtieth of May next ensuing. Item, that the duchy

speaker: GLOUCESTER
text_entry: of Anjou and the county of Maine shall be released

speaker: GLOUCESTER
text_entry: and delivered to the king her father--

speaker: GLOUCESTER
text_entry: Lets the paper fall

speaker: KING HENRY VI
text_entry: Uncle, how now!

speaker: GLOUCESTER
text_entry: Pardon me, gracious lord;

speaker: GLOUCESTER
text_entry: Some sudden qualm hath struck me at the heart

speaker: GLOUCESTER
text_entry: And dimmd mine eyes, that I can read no further.

speaker: KING HENRY VI
text_entry: Uncle of Winchester, I pray, read on.

speaker: CARDINAL
text_entry: [Reads]  Item, It is further agreed between them,

speaker: CARDINAL
text_entry: that the duchies of Anjou and Maine shall be

speaker: CARDINAL
text_entry: released and delivered over to the king her father,

speaker: CARDINAL
text_entry: and she sent over of the King of Englands own

speaker: CARDINAL
text_entry: proper cost and charges, without having any dowry.

speaker: KING HENRY VI
text_entry: They please us well. Lord marquess, kneel down:

speaker: KING HENRY VI
text_entry: We here create thee the first duke of Suffolk,

speaker: KING HENRY VI
text_entry: And gird thee with the sword. Cousin of York,

speaker: KING HENRY VI
text_entry: We here discharge your grace from being regent

speaker: KING HENRY VI
text_entry: I the parts of France, till term of eighteen months

speaker: KING HENRY VI
text_entry: Be full expired. Thanks, uncle Winchester,

speaker: KING HENRY VI
text_entry: Gloucester, York, Buckingham, Somerset,

speaker: KING HENRY VI
text_entry: Salisbury, and Warwick;

speaker: KING HENRY VI
text_entry: We thank you all for the great favour done,

speaker: KING HENRY VI
text_entry: In entertainment to my princely queen.

speaker: KING HENRY VI
text_entry: Come, let us in, and with all speed provide

speaker: KING HENRY VI
text_entry: To see her coronation be performd.

speaker: KING HENRY VI
text_entry: Exeunt KING HENRY VI, QUEEN MARGARET, and SUFFOLK

speaker: GLOUCESTER
text_entry: Brave peers of England, pillars of the state,

speaker: GLOUCESTER
text_entry: To you Duke Humphrey must unload his grief,

speaker: GLOUCESTER
text_entry: Your grief, the common grief of all the land.

speaker: GLOUCESTER
text_entry: What! did my brother Henry spend his youth,

speaker: GLOUCESTER
text_entry: His valour, coin and people, in the wars?

speaker: GLOUCESTER
text_entry: Did he so often lodge in open field,

speaker: GLOUCESTER
text_entry: In winters cold and summers parching heat,

speaker: GLOUCESTER
text_entry: To conquer France, his true inheritance?

speaker: GLOUCESTER
text_entry: And did my brother Bedford toil his wits,

speaker: GLOUCESTER
text_entry: To keep by policy what Henry got?

speaker: GLOUCESTER
text_entry: Have you yourselves, Somerset, Buckingham,

speaker: GLOUCESTER
text_entry: Brave York, Salisbury, and victorious Warwick,

speaker: GLOUCESTER
text_entry: Received deep scars in France and Normandy?

speaker: GLOUCESTER
text_entry: Or hath mine uncle Beaufort and myself,

speaker: GLOUCESTER
text_entry: With all the learned council of the realm,

speaker: GLOUCESTER
text_entry: Studied so long, sat in the council-house

speaker: GLOUCESTER
text_entry: Early and late, debating to and fro

speaker: GLOUCESTER
text_entry: How France and Frenchmen might be kept in awe,

speaker: GLOUCESTER
text_entry: And had his highness in his infancy

speaker: GLOUCESTER
text_entry: Crowned in Paris in despite of foes?

speaker: GLOUCESTER
text_entry: And shall these labours and these honours die?

speaker: GLOUCESTER
text_entry: Shall Henrys conquest, Bedfords vigilance,

speaker: GLOUCESTER
text_entry: Your deeds of war and all our counsel die?

speaker: GLOUCESTER
text_entry: O peers of England, shameful is this league!

speaker: GLOUCESTER
text_entry: Fatal this marriage, cancelling your fame,

speaker: GLOUCESTER
text_entry: Blotting your names from books of memory,

speaker: GLOUCESTER
text_entry: Razing the characters of your renown,

speaker: GLOUCESTER
text_entry: Defacing monuments of conquerd France,

speaker: GLOUCESTER
text_entry: Undoing all, as all had never been!

speaker: CARDINAL
text_entry: Nephew, what means this passionate discourse,

speaker: CARDINAL
text_entry: This peroration with such circumstance?

speaker: CARDINAL
text_entry: For France, tis ours; and we will keep it still.

speaker: GLOUCESTER
text_entry: Ay, uncle, we will keep it, if we can;

speaker: GLOUCESTER
text_entry: But now it is impossible we should:

speaker: GLOUCESTER
text_entry: Suffolk, the new-made duke that rules the roast,

speaker: GLOUCESTER
text_entry: Hath given the duchy of Anjou and Maine

speaker: GLOUCESTER
text_entry: Unto the poor King Reignier, whose large style

speaker: GLOUCESTER
text_entry: Agrees not with the leanness of his purse.

speaker: SALISBURY
text_entry: Now, by the death of Him that died for all,

speaker: SALISBURY
text_entry: These counties were the keys of Normandy.

speaker: SALISBURY
text_entry: But wherefore weeps Warwick, my valiant son?

speaker: WARWICK
text_entry: For grief that they are past recovery:

speaker: WARWICK
text_entry: For, were there hope to conquer them again,

speaker: WARWICK
text_entry: My sword should shed hot blood, mine eyes no tears.

speaker: WARWICK
text_entry: Anjou and Maine! myself did win them both;

speaker: WARWICK
text_entry: Those provinces these arms of mine did conquer:

speaker: WARWICK
text_entry: And are the cities, that I got with wounds,

speaker: WARWICK
text_entry: Delivered up again with peaceful words?

speaker: WARWICK
text_entry: Mort Dieu!

speaker: YORK
text_entry: For Suffolks duke, may he be suffocate,

speaker: YORK
text_entry: That dims the honour of this warlike isle!

speaker: YORK
text_entry: France should have torn and rent my very heart,

speaker: YORK
text_entry: Before I would have yielded to this league.

speaker: YORK
text_entry: I never read but Englands kings have had

speaker: YORK
text_entry: Large sums of gold and dowries with their wives:

speaker: YORK
text_entry: And our King Henry gives away his own,

speaker: YORK
text_entry: To match with her that brings no vantages.

speaker: GLOUCESTER
text_entry: A proper jest, and never heard before,

speaker: GLOUCESTER
text_entry: That Suffolk should demand a whole fifteenth

speaker: GLOUCESTER
text_entry: For costs and charges in transporting her!

speaker: GLOUCESTER
text_entry: She should have stayed in France and starved

speaker: GLOUCESTER
text_entry: in France, Before--

speaker: CARDINAL
text_entry: My Lord of Gloucester, now ye grow too hot:

speaker: CARDINAL
text_entry: It was the pleasure of my lord the King.

speaker: GLOUCESTER
text_entry: My Lord of Winchester, I know your mind;

speaker: GLOUCESTER
text_entry: Tis not my speeches that you do mislike,

speaker: GLOUCESTER
text_entry: But tis my presence that doth trouble ye.

speaker: GLOUCESTER
text_entry: Rancour will out: proud prelate, in thy face

speaker: GLOUCESTER
text_entry: I see thy fury: if I longer stay,

speaker: GLOUCESTER
text_entry: We shall begin our ancient bickerings.

speaker: GLOUCESTER
text_entry: Lordings, farewell; and say, when I am gone,

speaker: GLOUCESTER
text_entry: I prophesied France will be lost ere long.

speaker: GLOUCESTER
text_entry: Exit

speaker: CARDINAL
text_entry: So, there goes our protector in a rage.

speaker: CARDINAL
text_entry: Tis known to you he is mine enemy,

speaker: CARDINAL
text_entry: Nay, more, an enemy unto you all,

speaker: CARDINAL
text_entry: And no great friend, I fear me, to the king.

speaker: CARDINAL
text_entry: Consider, lords, he is the next of blood,

speaker: CARDINAL
text_entry: And heir apparent to the English crown:

speaker: CARDINAL
text_entry: Had Henry got an empire by his marriage,

speaker: CARDINAL
text_entry: And all the wealthy kingdoms of the west,

speaker: CARDINAL
text_entry: Theres reason he should be displeased at it.

speaker: CARDINAL
text_entry: Look to it, lords! let not his smoothing words

speaker: CARDINAL
text_entry: Bewitch your hearts; be wise and circumspect.

speaker: CARDINAL
text_entry: What though the common people favour him,

speaker: CARDINAL
text_entry: Calling him Humphrey, the good Duke of

speaker: CARDINAL
text_entry: Gloucester,

speaker: CARDINAL
text_entry: Clapping their hands, and crying with loud voice,

speaker: CARDINAL
text_entry: Jesu maintain your royal excellence!

speaker: CARDINAL
text_entry: With God preserve the good Duke Humphrey!

speaker: CARDINAL
text_entry: I fear me, lords, for all this flattering gloss,

speaker: CARDINAL
text_entry: He will be found a dangerous protector.

speaker: BUCKINGHAM
text_entry: Why should he, then, protect our sovereign,

speaker: BUCKINGHAM
text_entry: He being of age to govern of himself?

speaker: BUCKINGHAM
text_entry: Cousin of Somerset, join you with me,

speaker: BUCKINGHAM
text_entry: And all together, with the Duke of Suffolk,

speaker: BUCKINGHAM
text_entry: Well quickly hoise Duke Humphrey from his seat.

speaker: CARDINAL
text_entry: This weighty business will not brook delay:

speaker: CARDINAL
text_entry: Ill to the Duke of Suffolk presently.

speaker: CARDINAL
text_entry: Exit

speaker: SOMERSET
text_entry: Cousin of Buckingham, though Humphreys pride

speaker: SOMERSET
text_entry: And greatness of his place be grief to us,

speaker: SOMERSET
text_entry: Yet let us watch the haughty cardinal:

speaker: SOMERSET
text_entry: His insolence is more intolerable

speaker: SOMERSET
text_entry: Than all the princes in the land beside:

speaker: SOMERSET
text_entry: If Gloucester be displaced, hell be protector.

speaker: BUCKINGHAM
text_entry: Or thou or I, Somerset, will be protector,

speaker: BUCKINGHAM
text_entry: Despite Duke Humphrey or the cardinal.

speaker: BUCKINGHAM
text_entry: Exeunt BUCKINGHAM and SOMERSET

speaker: SALISBURY
text_entry: Pride went before, ambition follows him.

speaker: SALISBURY
text_entry: While these do labour for their own preferment,

speaker: SALISBURY
text_entry: Behoves it us to labour for the realm.

speaker: SALISBURY
text_entry: I never saw but Humphrey Duke of Gloucester

speaker: SALISBURY
text_entry: Did bear him like a noble gentleman.

speaker: SALISBURY
text_entry: Oft have I seen the haughty cardinal,

speaker: SALISBURY
text_entry: More like a soldier than a man o the church,

speaker: SALISBURY
text_entry: As stout and proud as he were lord of all,

speaker: SALISBURY
text_entry: Swear like a ruffian and demean himself

speaker: SALISBURY
text_entry: Unlike the ruler of a commonweal.

speaker: SALISBURY
text_entry: Warwick, my son, the comfort of my age,

speaker: SALISBURY
text_entry: Thy deeds, thy plainness and thy housekeeping,

speaker: SALISBURY
text_entry: Hath won the greatest favour of the commons,

speaker: SALISBURY
text_entry: Excepting none but good Duke Humphrey:

speaker: SALISBURY
text_entry: And, brother York, thy acts in Ireland,

speaker: SALISBURY
text_entry: In bringing them to civil discipline,

speaker: SALISBURY
text_entry: Thy late exploits done in the heart of France,

speaker: SALISBURY
text_entry: When thou wert regent for our sovereign,

speaker: SALISBURY
text_entry: Have made thee feard and honourd of the people:

speaker: SALISBURY
text_entry: Join we together, for the public good,

speaker: SALISBURY
text_entry: In what we can, to bridle and suppress

speaker: SALISBURY
text_entry: The pride of Suffolk and the cardinal,

speaker: SALISBURY
text_entry: With Somersets and Buckinghams ambition;

speaker: SALISBURY
text_entry: And, as we may, cherish Duke Humphreys deeds,

speaker: SALISBURY
text_entry: While they do tend the profit of the land.

speaker: WARWICK
text_entry: So God help Warwick, as he loves the land,

speaker: WARWICK
text_entry: And common profit of his country!

speaker: YORK
text_entry: [Aside]  And so says York, for he hath greatest cause.

speaker: SALISBURY
text_entry: Then lets make haste away, and look unto the main.

speaker: WARWICK
text_entry: Unto the main! O father, Maine is lost;

speaker: WARWICK
text_entry: That Maine which by main force Warwick did win,

speaker: WARWICK
text_entry: And would have kept so long as breath did last!

speaker: WARWICK
text_entry: Main chance, father, you meant; but I meant Maine,

speaker: WARWICK
text_entry: Which I will win from France, or else be slain,

speaker: WARWICK
text_entry: Exeunt WARWICK and SALISBURY

speaker: YORK
text_entry: Anjou and Maine are given to the French;

speaker: YORK
text_entry: Paris is lost; the state of Normandy

speaker: YORK
text_entry: Stands on a tickle point, now they are gone:

speaker: YORK
text_entry: Suffolk concluded on the articles,

speaker: YORK
text_entry: The peers agreed, and Henry was well pleased

speaker: YORK
text_entry: To change two dukedoms for a dukes fair daughter.

speaker: YORK
text_entry: I cannot blame them all: what ist to them?

speaker: YORK
text_entry: Tis thine they give away, and not their own.

speaker: YORK
text_entry: Pirates may make cheap pennyworths of their pillage

speaker: YORK
text_entry: And purchase friends and give to courtezans,

speaker: YORK
text_entry: Still revelling like lords till all be gone;

speaker: YORK
text_entry: While as the silly owner of the goods

speaker: YORK
text_entry: Weeps over them and wrings his hapless hands

speaker: YORK
text_entry: And shakes his head and trembling stands aloof,

speaker: YORK
text_entry: While all is shared and all is borne away,

speaker: YORK
text_entry: Ready to starve and dare not touch his own:

speaker: YORK
text_entry: So York must sit and fret and bite his tongue,

speaker: YORK
text_entry: While his own lands are bargaind for and sold.

speaker: YORK
text_entry: Methinks the realms of England, France and Ireland

speaker: YORK
text_entry: Bear that proportion to my flesh and blood

speaker: YORK
text_entry: As did the fatal brand Althaea burnd

speaker: YORK
text_entry: Unto the princes heart of Calydon.

speaker: YORK
text_entry: Anjou and Maine both given unto the French!

speaker: YORK
text_entry: Cold news for me, for I had hope of France,

speaker: YORK
text_entry: Even as I have of fertile Englands soil.

speaker: YORK
text_entry: A day will come when York shall claim his own;

speaker: YORK
text_entry: And therefore I will take the Nevils parts

speaker: YORK
text_entry: And make a show of love to proud Duke Humphrey,

speaker: YORK
text_entry: And, when I spy advantage, claim the crown,

speaker: YORK
text_entry: For thats the golden mark I seek to hit:

speaker: YORK
text_entry: Nor shall proud Lancaster usurp my right,

speaker: YORK
text_entry: Nor hold the sceptre in his childish fist,

speaker: YORK
text_entry: Nor wear the diadem upon his head,

speaker: YORK
text_entry: Whose church-like humours fits not for a crown.

speaker: YORK
text_entry: Then, York, be still awhile, till time do serve:

speaker: YORK
text_entry: Watch thou and wake when others be asleep,

speaker: YORK
text_entry: To pry into the secrets of the state;

speaker: YORK
text_entry: Till Henry, surfeiting in joys of love,

speaker: YORK
text_entry: With his new bride and Englands dear-bought queen,

speaker: YORK
text_entry: And Humphrey with the peers be falln at jars:

speaker: YORK
text_entry: Then will I raise aloft the milk-white rose,

speaker: YORK
text_entry: With whose sweet smell the air shall be perfumed;

speaker: YORK
text_entry: And in my standard bear the arms of York

speaker: YORK
text_entry: To grapple with the house of Lancaster;

speaker: YORK
text_entry: And, force perforce, Ill make him yield the crown,

speaker: YORK
text_entry: Whose bookish rule hath pulld fair England down.

speaker: YORK
text_entry: Exit

speaker: YORK
text_entry: SCENE II. GLOUCESTERS house.

speaker: YORK
text_entry: Enter GLOUCESTER and his DUCHESS

speaker: DUCHESS
text_entry: Why droops my lord, like over-ripend corn,

speaker: DUCHESS
text_entry: Hanging the head at Ceres plenteous load?

speaker: DUCHESS
text_entry: Why doth the great Duke Humphrey knit his brows,

speaker: DUCHESS
text_entry: As frowning at the favours of the world?

speaker: DUCHESS
text_entry: Why are thine eyes fixed to the sullen earth,

speaker: DUCHESS
text_entry: Gazing on that which seems to dim thy sight?

speaker: DUCHESS
text_entry: What seest thou there? King Henrys diadem,

speaker: DUCHESS
text_entry: Enchased with all the honours of the world?

speaker: DUCHESS
text_entry: If so, gaze on, and grovel on thy face,

speaker: DUCHESS
text_entry: Until thy head be circled with the same.

speaker: DUCHESS
text_entry: Put forth thy hand, reach at the glorious gold.

speaker: DUCHESS
text_entry: What, ist too short? Ill lengthen it with mine:

speaker: DUCHESS
text_entry: And, having both together heaved it up,

speaker: DUCHESS
text_entry: Well both together lift our heads to heaven,

speaker: DUCHESS
text_entry: And never more abase our sight so low

speaker: DUCHESS
text_entry: As to vouchsafe one glance unto the ground.

speaker: GLOUCESTER
text_entry: O Nell, sweet Nell, if thou dost love thy lord,

speaker: GLOUCESTER
text_entry: Banish the canker of ambitious thoughts.

speaker: GLOUCESTER
text_entry: And may that thought, when I imagine ill

speaker: GLOUCESTER
text_entry: Against my king and nephew, virtuous Henry,

speaker: GLOUCESTER
text_entry: Be my last breathing in this mortal world!

speaker: GLOUCESTER
text_entry: My troublous dream this night doth make me sad.

speaker: DUCHESS
text_entry: What dreamd my lord? tell me, and Ill requite it

speaker: DUCHESS
text_entry: With sweet rehearsal of my mornings dream.

speaker: GLOUCESTER
text_entry: Methought this staff, mine office-badge in court,

speaker: GLOUCESTER
text_entry: Was broke in twain; by whom I have forgot,

speaker: GLOUCESTER
text_entry: But, as I think, it was by the cardinal;

speaker: GLOUCESTER
text_entry: And on the pieces of the broken wand

speaker: GLOUCESTER
text_entry: Were placed the heads of Edmund Duke of Somerset,

speaker: GLOUCESTER
text_entry: And William de la Pole, first duke of Suffolk.

speaker: GLOUCESTER
text_entry: This was my dream: what it doth bode, God knows.

speaker: DUCHESS
text_entry: Tut, this was nothing but an argument

speaker: DUCHESS
text_entry: That he that breaks a stick of Gloucesters grove

speaker: DUCHESS
text_entry: Shall lose his head for his presumption.

speaker: DUCHESS
text_entry: But list to me, my Humphrey, my sweet duke:

speaker: DUCHESS
text_entry: Methought I sat in seat of majesty

speaker: DUCHESS
text_entry: In the cathedral church of Westminster,

speaker: DUCHESS
text_entry: And in that chair where kings and queens are crownd;

speaker: DUCHESS
text_entry: Where Henry and dame Margaret kneeld to me

speaker: DUCHESS
text_entry: And on my head did set the diadem.

speaker: GLOUCESTER
text_entry: Nay, Eleanor, then must I chide outright:

speaker: GLOUCESTER
text_entry: Presumptuous dame, ill-nurtured Eleanor,

speaker: GLOUCESTER
text_entry: Art thou not second woman in the realm,

speaker: GLOUCESTER
text_entry: And the protectors wife, beloved of him?

speaker: GLOUCESTER
text_entry: Hast thou not worldly pleasure at command,

speaker: GLOUCESTER
text_entry: Above the reach or compass of thy thought?

speaker: GLOUCESTER
text_entry: And wilt thou still be hammering treachery,

speaker: GLOUCESTER
text_entry: To tumble down thy husband and thyself

speaker: GLOUCESTER
text_entry: From top of honour to disgraces feet?

speaker: GLOUCESTER
text_entry: Away from me, and let me hear no more!

speaker: DUCHESS
text_entry: What, what, my lord! are you so choleric

speaker: DUCHESS
text_entry: With Eleanor, for telling but her dream?

speaker: DUCHESS
text_entry: Next time Ill keep my dreams unto myself,

speaker: DUCHESS
text_entry: And not be chequed.

speaker: GLOUCESTER
text_entry: Nay, be not angry; I am pleased again.

speaker: GLOUCESTER
text_entry: Enter Messenger

speaker: Messenger
text_entry: My lord protector, tis his highness pleasure

speaker: Messenger
text_entry: You do prepare to ride unto Saint Albans,

speaker: Messenger
text_entry: Where as the king and queen do mean to hawk.

speaker: GLOUCESTER
text_entry: I go. Come, Nell, thou wilt ride with us?

speaker: DUCHESS
text_entry: Yes, my good lord, Ill follow presently.

speaker: DUCHESS
text_entry: Exeunt GLOUCESTER and Messenger

speaker: DUCHESS
text_entry: Follow I must; I cannot go before,

speaker: DUCHESS
text_entry: While Gloucester bears this base and humble mind.

speaker: DUCHESS
text_entry: Were I a man, a duke, and next of blood,

speaker: DUCHESS
text_entry: I would remove these tedious stumbling-blocks

speaker: DUCHESS
text_entry: And smooth my way upon their headless necks;

speaker: DUCHESS
text_entry: And, being a woman, I will not be slack

speaker: DUCHESS
text_entry: To play my part in Fortunes pageant.

speaker: DUCHESS
text_entry: Where are you there? Sir John! nay, fear not, man,

speaker: DUCHESS
text_entry: We are alone; heres none but thee and I.

speaker: DUCHESS
text_entry: Enter HUME

speaker: HUME
text_entry: Jesus preserve your royal majesty!

speaker: DUCHESS
text_entry: What sayst thou? majesty! I am but grace.

speaker: HUME
text_entry: But, by the grace of God, and Humes advice,

speaker: HUME
text_entry: Your graces title shall be multiplied.

speaker: DUCHESS
text_entry: What sayst thou, man? hast thou as yet conferrd

speaker: DUCHESS
text_entry: With Margery Jourdain, the cunning witch,

speaker: DUCHESS
text_entry: With Roger Bolingbroke, the conjurer?

speaker: DUCHESS
text_entry: And will they undertake to do me good?

speaker: HUME
text_entry: This they have promised, to show your highness

speaker: HUME
text_entry: A spirit raised from depth of under-ground,

speaker: HUME
text_entry: That shall make answer to such questions

speaker: HUME
text_entry: As by your grace shall be propounded him.

speaker: DUCHESS
text_entry: It is enough; Ill think upon the questions:

speaker: DUCHESS
text_entry: When from St. Albans we do make return,

speaker: DUCHESS
text_entry: Well see these things effected to the full.

speaker: DUCHESS
text_entry: Here, Hume, take this reward; make merry, man,

speaker: DUCHESS
text_entry: With thy confederates in this weighty cause.

speaker: DUCHESS
text_entry: Exit

speaker: HUME
text_entry: Hume must make merry with the duchess gold;

speaker: HUME
text_entry: Marry, and shall. But how now, Sir John Hume!

speaker: HUME
text_entry: Seal up your lips, and give no words but mum:

speaker: HUME
text_entry: The business asketh silent secrecy.

speaker: HUME
text_entry: Dame Eleanor gives gold to bring the witch:

speaker: HUME
text_entry: Gold cannot come amiss, were she a devil.

speaker: HUME
text_entry: Yet have I gold flies from another coast;

speaker: HUME
text_entry: I dare not say, from the rich cardinal

speaker: HUME
text_entry: And from the great and new-made Duke of Suffolk,

speaker: HUME
text_entry: Yet I do find it so; for to be plain,

speaker: HUME
text_entry: They, knowing Dame Eleanors aspiring humour,

speaker: HUME
text_entry: Have hired me to undermine the duchess

speaker: HUME
text_entry: And buz these conjurations in her brain.

speaker: HUME
text_entry: They say A crafty knave does need no broker;

speaker: HUME
text_entry: Yet am I Suffolk and the cardinals broker.

speaker: HUME
text_entry: Hume, if you take not heed, you shall go near

speaker: HUME
text_entry: To call them both a pair of crafty knaves.

speaker: HUME
text_entry: Well, so it stands; and thus, I fear, at last

speaker: HUME
text_entry: Humes knavery will be the duchess wreck,

speaker: HUME
text_entry: And her attainture will be Humphreys fall:

speaker: HUME
text_entry: Sort how it will, I shall have gold for all.

speaker: HUME
text_entry: Exit

speaker: HUME
text_entry: SCENE III. The palace.

speaker: HUME
text_entry: Enter three or four Petitioners, PETER, the Armourers man, being one

speaker: First Petitioner
text_entry: My masters, lets stand close: my lord protector

speaker: First Petitioner
text_entry: will come this way by and by, and then we may deliver

speaker: First Petitioner
text_entry: our supplications in the quill.

speaker: Second Petitioner
text_entry: Marry, the Lord protect him, for hes a good man!

speaker: Second Petitioner
text_entry: Jesu bless him!

speaker: Second Petitioner
text_entry: Enter SUFFOLK and QUEEN MARGARET

speaker: PETER
text_entry: Here a comes, methinks, and the queen with him.

speaker: PETER
text_entry: Ill be the first, sure.

speaker: Second Petitioner
text_entry: Come back, fool; this is the Duke of Suffolk, and

speaker: Second Petitioner
text_entry: not my lord protector.

speaker: SUFFOLK
text_entry: How now, fellow! wouldst anything with me?

speaker: First Petitioner
text_entry: I pray, my lord, pardon me; I took ye for my lord

speaker: First Petitioner
text_entry: protector.

speaker: QUEEN MARGARET
text_entry: [Reading]  To my Lord Protector! Are your

speaker: QUEEN MARGARET
text_entry: supplications to his lordship? Let me see them:

speaker: QUEEN MARGARET
text_entry: what is thine?

speaker: First Petitioner
text_entry: Mine is, ant please your grace, against John

speaker: First Petitioner
text_entry: Goodman, my lord cardinals man, for keeping my

speaker: First Petitioner
text_entry: house, and lands, and wife and all, from me.

speaker: SUFFOLK
text_entry: Thy wife, too! thats some wrong, indeed. Whats

speaker: SUFFOLK
text_entry: yours? Whats here!

speaker: SUFFOLK
text_entry: Reads

speaker: SUFFOLK
text_entry: Against the Duke of Suffolk, for enclosing the

speaker: SUFFOLK
text_entry: commons of Melford. How now, sir knave!

speaker: Second Petitioner
text_entry: Alas, sir, I am but a poor petitioner of our whole township.

speaker: PETER
text_entry: [Giving his petition]  Against my master, Thomas

speaker: PETER
text_entry: Horner, for saying that the Duke of York was rightful

speaker: PETER
text_entry: heir to the crown.

speaker: QUEEN MARGARET
text_entry: What sayst thou? did the Duke of York say he was

speaker: QUEEN MARGARET
text_entry: rightful heir to the crown?

speaker: PETER
text_entry: That my master was? no, forsooth: my master said

speaker: PETER
text_entry: that he was, and that the king was an usurper.

speaker: SUFFOLK
text_entry: Who is there?

speaker: SUFFOLK
text_entry: Enter Servant

speaker: SUFFOLK
text_entry: Take this fellow in, and send for

speaker: SUFFOLK
text_entry: his master with a pursuivant presently: well hear

speaker: SUFFOLK
text_entry: more of your matter before the King.

speaker: SUFFOLK
text_entry: Exit Servant with PETER

speaker: QUEEN MARGARET
text_entry: And as for you, that love to be protected

speaker: QUEEN MARGARET
text_entry: Under the wings of our protectors grace,

speaker: QUEEN MARGARET
text_entry: Begin your suits anew, and sue to him.

speaker: QUEEN MARGARET
text_entry: Tears the supplication

speaker: QUEEN MARGARET
text_entry: Away, base cullions! Suffolk, let them go.

speaker: ALL
text_entry: Come, lets be gone.

speaker: ALL
text_entry: Exeunt

speaker: QUEEN MARGARET
text_entry: My Lord of Suffolk, say, is this the guise,

speaker: QUEEN MARGARET
text_entry: Is this the fashion in the court of England?

speaker: QUEEN MARGARET
text_entry: Is this the government of Britains isle,

speaker: QUEEN MARGARET
text_entry: And this the royalty of Albions king?

speaker: QUEEN MARGARET
text_entry: What shall King Henry be a pupil still

speaker: QUEEN MARGARET
text_entry: Under the surly Gloucesters governance?

speaker: QUEEN MARGARET
text_entry: Am I a queen in title and in style,

speaker: QUEEN MARGARET
text_entry: And must be made a subject to a duke?

speaker: QUEEN MARGARET
text_entry: I tell thee, Pole, when in the city Tours

speaker: QUEEN MARGARET
text_entry: Thou ranst a tilt in honour of my love

speaker: QUEEN MARGARET
text_entry: And stolest away the ladies hearts of France,

speaker: QUEEN MARGARET
text_entry: I thought King Henry had resembled thee

speaker: QUEEN MARGARET
text_entry: In courage, courtship and proportion:

speaker: QUEEN MARGARET
text_entry: But all his mind is bent to holiness,

speaker: QUEEN MARGARET
text_entry: To number Ave-Maries on his beads;

speaker: QUEEN MARGARET
text_entry: His champions are the prophets and apostles,

speaker: QUEEN MARGARET
text_entry: His weapons holy saws of sacred writ,

speaker: QUEEN MARGARET
text_entry: His study is his tilt-yard, and his loves

speaker: QUEEN MARGARET
text_entry: Are brazen images of canonized saints.

speaker: QUEEN MARGARET
text_entry: I would the college of the cardinals

speaker: QUEEN MARGARET
text_entry: Would choose him pope, and carry him to Rome,

speaker: QUEEN MARGARET
text_entry: And set the triple crown upon his head:

speaker: QUEEN MARGARET
text_entry: That were a state fit for his holiness.

speaker: SUFFOLK
text_entry: Madam, be patient: as I was cause

speaker: SUFFOLK
text_entry: Your highness came to England, so will I

speaker: SUFFOLK
text_entry: In England work your graces full content.

speaker: QUEEN MARGARET
text_entry: Beside the haughty protector, have we Beaufort,

speaker: QUEEN MARGARET
text_entry: The imperious churchman, Somerset, Buckingham,

speaker: QUEEN MARGARET
text_entry: And grumbling York: and not the least of these

speaker: QUEEN MARGARET
text_entry: But can do more in England than the king.

speaker: SUFFOLK
text_entry: And he of these that can do most of all

speaker: SUFFOLK
text_entry: Cannot do more in England than the Nevils:

speaker: SUFFOLK
text_entry: Salisbury and Warwick are no simple peers.

speaker: QUEEN MARGARET
text_entry: Not all these lords do vex me half so much

speaker: QUEEN MARGARET
text_entry: As that proud dame, the lord protectors wife.

speaker: QUEEN MARGARET
text_entry: She sweeps it through the court with troops of ladies,

speaker: QUEEN MARGARET
text_entry: More like an empress than Duke Humphreys wife:

speaker: QUEEN MARGARET
text_entry: Strangers in court do take her for the queen:

speaker: QUEEN MARGARET
text_entry: She bears a dukes revenues on her back,

speaker: QUEEN MARGARET
text_entry: And in her heart she scorns our poverty:

speaker: QUEEN MARGARET
text_entry: Shall I not live to be avenged on her?

speaker: QUEEN MARGARET
text_entry: Contemptuous base-born callet as she is,

speaker: QUEEN MARGARET
text_entry: She vaunted mongst her minions tother day,

speaker: QUEEN MARGARET
text_entry: The very train of her worst wearing gown

speaker: QUEEN MARGARET
text_entry: Was better worth than all my fathers lands,

speaker: QUEEN MARGARET
text_entry: Till Suffolk gave two dukedoms for his daughter.

speaker: SUFFOLK
text_entry: Madam, myself have limed a bush for her,

speaker: SUFFOLK
text_entry: And placed a quire of such enticing birds,

speaker: SUFFOLK
text_entry: That she will light to listen to the lays,

speaker: SUFFOLK
text_entry: And never mount to trouble you again.

speaker: SUFFOLK
text_entry: So, let her rest: and, madam, list to me;

speaker: SUFFOLK
text_entry: For I am bold to counsel you in this.

speaker: SUFFOLK
text_entry: Although we fancy not the cardinal,

speaker: SUFFOLK
text_entry: Yet must we join with him and with the lords,

speaker: SUFFOLK
text_entry: Till we have brought Duke Humphrey in disgrace.

speaker: SUFFOLK
text_entry: As for the Duke of York, this late complaint

speaker: SUFFOLK
text_entry: Will make but little for his benefit.

speaker: SUFFOLK
text_entry: So, one by one, well weed them all at last,

speaker: SUFFOLK
text_entry: And you yourself shall steer the happy helm.

speaker: SUFFOLK
text_entry: Sound a sennet. Enter KING HENRY VI, GLOUCESTER,  CARDINAL, BUCKINGHAM, YORK, SOMERSET, SALISBURY, WARWICK, and the DUCHESS

speaker: KING HENRY VI
text_entry: For my part, noble lords, I care not which;

speaker: KING HENRY VI
text_entry: Or Somerset or York, alls one to me.

speaker: YORK
text_entry: If York have ill demeand himself in France,

speaker: YORK
text_entry: Then let him be denayd the regentship.

speaker: SOMERSET
text_entry: If Somerset be unworthy of the place,

speaker: SOMERSET
text_entry: Let York be regent; I will yield to him.

speaker: WARWICK
text_entry: Whether your grace be worthy, yea or no,

speaker: WARWICK
text_entry: Dispute not that: York is the worthier.

speaker: CARDINAL
text_entry: Ambitious Warwick, let thy betters speak.

speaker: WARWICK
text_entry: The cardinals not my better in the field.

speaker: BUCKINGHAM
text_entry: All in this presence are thy betters, Warwick.

speaker: WARWICK
text_entry: Warwick may live to be the best of all.

speaker: SALISBURY
text_entry: Peace, son! and show some reason, Buckingham,

speaker: SALISBURY
text_entry: Why Somerset should be preferred in this.

speaker: QUEEN MARGARET
text_entry: Because the king, forsooth, will have it so.

speaker: GLOUCESTER
text_entry: Madam, the king is old enough himself

speaker: GLOUCESTER
text_entry: To give his censure: these are no womens matters.

speaker: QUEEN MARGARET
text_entry: If he be old enough, what needs your grace

speaker: QUEEN MARGARET
text_entry: To be protector of his excellence?

speaker: GLOUCESTER
text_entry: Madam, I am protector of the realm;

speaker: GLOUCESTER
text_entry: And, at his pleasure, will resign my place.

speaker: SUFFOLK
text_entry: Resign it then and leave thine insolence.

speaker: SUFFOLK
text_entry: Since thou wert king--as who is king but thou?--

speaker: SUFFOLK
text_entry: The commonwealth hath daily run to wreck;

speaker: SUFFOLK
text_entry: The Dauphin hath prevaild beyond the seas;

speaker: SUFFOLK
text_entry: And all the peers and nobles of the realm

speaker: SUFFOLK
text_entry: Have been as bondmen to thy sovereignty.

speaker: CARDINAL
text_entry: The commons hast thou rackd; the clergys bags

speaker: CARDINAL
text_entry: Are lank and lean with thy extortions.

speaker: SOMERSET
text_entry: Thy sumptuous buildings and thy wifes attire

speaker: SOMERSET
text_entry: Have cost a mass of public treasury.

speaker: BUCKINGHAM
text_entry: Thy cruelty in execution

speaker: BUCKINGHAM
text_entry: Upon offenders, hath exceeded law,

speaker: BUCKINGHAM
text_entry: And left thee to the mercy of the law.

speaker: QUEEN MARGARET
text_entry: They sale of offices and towns in France,

speaker: QUEEN MARGARET
text_entry: If they were known, as the suspect is great,

speaker: QUEEN MARGARET
text_entry: Would make thee quickly hop without thy head.

speaker: QUEEN MARGARET
text_entry: Exit GLOUCESTER. QUEEN MARGARET drops her fan

speaker: QUEEN MARGARET
text_entry: Give me my fan: what, minion! can ye not?

speaker: QUEEN MARGARET
text_entry: She gives the DUCHESS a box on the ear

speaker: QUEEN MARGARET
text_entry: I cry you mercy, madam; was it you?

speaker: DUCHESS
text_entry: Wast I! yea, I it was, proud Frenchwoman:

speaker: DUCHESS
text_entry: Could I come near your beauty with my nails,

speaker: DUCHESS
text_entry: Id set my ten commandments in your face.

speaker: KING HENRY VI
text_entry: Sweet aunt, be quiet; twas against her will.

speaker: DUCHESS
text_entry: Against her will! good king, look tot in time;

speaker: DUCHESS
text_entry: Shell hamper thee, and dandle thee like a baby:

speaker: DUCHESS
text_entry: Though in this place most master wear no breeches,

speaker: DUCHESS
text_entry: She shall not strike Dame Eleanor unrevenged.

speaker: DUCHESS
text_entry: Exit

speaker: BUCKINGHAM
text_entry: Lord cardinal, I will follow Eleanor,

speaker: BUCKINGHAM
text_entry: And listen after Humphrey, how he proceeds:

speaker: BUCKINGHAM
text_entry: Shes tickled now; her fume needs no spurs,

speaker: BUCKINGHAM
text_entry: Shell gallop far enough to her destruction.

speaker: BUCKINGHAM
text_entry: Exit

speaker: BUCKINGHAM
text_entry: Re-enter GLOUCESTER

speaker: GLOUCESTER
text_entry: Now, lords, my choler being over-blown

speaker: GLOUCESTER
text_entry: With walking once about the quadrangle,

speaker: GLOUCESTER
text_entry: I come to talk of commonwealth affairs.

speaker: GLOUCESTER
text_entry: As for your spiteful false objections,

speaker: GLOUCESTER
text_entry: Prove them, and I lie open to the law:

speaker: GLOUCESTER
text_entry: But God in mercy so deal with my soul,

speaker: GLOUCESTER
text_entry: As I in duty love my king and country!

speaker: GLOUCESTER
text_entry: But, to the matter that we have in hand:

speaker: GLOUCESTER
text_entry: I say, my sovereign, York is meetest man

speaker: GLOUCESTER
text_entry: To be your regent in the realm of France.

speaker: SUFFOLK
text_entry: Before we make election, give me leave

speaker: SUFFOLK
text_entry: To show some reason, of no little force,

speaker: SUFFOLK
text_entry: That York is most unmeet of any man.

speaker: YORK
text_entry: Ill tell thee, Suffolk, why I am unmeet:

speaker: YORK
text_entry: First, for I cannot flatter thee in pride;

speaker: YORK
text_entry: Next, if I be appointed for the place,

speaker: YORK
text_entry: My Lord of Somerset will keep me here,

speaker: YORK
text_entry: Without discharge, money, or furniture,

speaker: YORK
text_entry: Till France be won into the Dauphins hands:

speaker: YORK
text_entry: Last time, I danced attendance on his will

speaker: YORK
text_entry: Till Paris was besieged, famishd, and lost.

speaker: WARWICK
text_entry: That can I witness; and a fouler fact

speaker: WARWICK
text_entry: Did never traitor in the land commit.

speaker: SUFFOLK
text_entry: Peace, headstrong Warwick!

speaker: WARWICK
text_entry: Image of pride, why should I hold my peace?

speaker: WARWICK
text_entry: Enter HORNER, the Armourer, and his man PETER, guarded

speaker: SUFFOLK
text_entry: Because here is a man accused of treason:

speaker: SUFFOLK
text_entry: Pray God the Duke of York excuse himself!

speaker: YORK
text_entry: Doth any one accuse York for a traitor?

speaker: KING HENRY VI
text_entry: What meanst thou, Suffolk; tell me, what are these?

speaker: SUFFOLK
text_entry: Please it your majesty, this is the man

speaker: SUFFOLK
text_entry: That doth accuse his master of high treason:

speaker: SUFFOLK
text_entry: His words were these: that Richard, Duke of York,

speaker: SUFFOLK
text_entry: Was rightful heir unto the English crown

speaker: SUFFOLK
text_entry: And that your majesty was a usurper.

speaker: KING HENRY VI
text_entry: Say, man, were these thy words?

speaker: HORNER
text_entry: Ant shall please your majesty, I never said nor

speaker: HORNER
text_entry: thought any such matter: God is my witness, I am

speaker: HORNER
text_entry: falsely accused by the villain.

speaker: PETER
text_entry: By these ten bones, my lords, he did speak them to

speaker: PETER
text_entry: me in the garret one night, as we were scouring my

speaker: PETER
text_entry: Lord of Yorks armour.

speaker: YORK
text_entry: Base dunghill villain and mechanical,

speaker: YORK
text_entry: Ill have thy head for this thy traitors speech.

speaker: YORK
text_entry: I do beseech your royal majesty,

speaker: YORK
text_entry: Let him have all the rigor of the law.

speaker: HORNER
text_entry: Alas, my lord, hang me, if ever I spake the words.

speaker: HORNER
text_entry: My accuser is my prentice; and when I did correct

speaker: HORNER
text_entry: him for his fault the other day, he did vow upon his

speaker: HORNER
text_entry: knees he would be even with me: I have good

speaker: HORNER
text_entry: witness of this: therefore I beseech your majesty,

speaker: HORNER
text_entry: do not cast away an honest man for a villains

speaker: HORNER
text_entry: accusation.

speaker: KING HENRY VI
text_entry: Uncle, what shall we say to this in law?

speaker: GLOUCESTER
text_entry: This doom, my lord, if I may judge:

speaker: GLOUCESTER
text_entry: Let Somerset be regent over the French,

speaker: GLOUCESTER
text_entry: Because in York this breeds suspicion:

speaker: GLOUCESTER
text_entry: And let these have a day appointed them

speaker: GLOUCESTER
text_entry: For single combat in convenient place,

speaker: GLOUCESTER
text_entry: For he hath witness of his servants malice:

speaker: GLOUCESTER
text_entry: This is the law, and this Duke Humphreys doom.

speaker: SOMERSET
text_entry: I humbly thank your royal majesty.

speaker: HORNER
text_entry: And I accept the combat willingly.

speaker: PETER
text_entry: Alas, my lord, I cannot fight; for Gods sake, pity

speaker: PETER
text_entry: my case. The spite of man prevaileth against me. O

speaker: PETER
text_entry: Lord, have mercy upon me! I shall never be able to

speaker: PETER
text_entry: fight a blow. O Lord, my heart!

speaker: GLOUCESTER
text_entry: Sirrah, or you must fight, or else be hangd.

speaker: KING HENRY VI
text_entry: Away with them to prison; and the day of combat

speaker: KING HENRY VI
text_entry: shall be the last of the next month. Come,

speaker: KING HENRY VI
text_entry: Somerset, well see thee sent away.

speaker: KING HENRY VI
text_entry: Flourish. Exeunt

speaker: KING HENRY VI
text_entry: SCENE IV. GLOUCESTERs garden.

speaker: KING HENRY VI
text_entry: Enter MARGARET JOURDAIN, HUME, SOUTHWELL, and BOLINGBROKE

speaker: HUME
text_entry: Come, my masters; the duchess, I tell you, expects

speaker: HUME
text_entry: performance of your promises.

speaker: BOLINGBROKE
text_entry: Master Hume, we are therefore provided: will her

speaker: BOLINGBROKE
text_entry: ladyship behold and hear our exorcisms?

speaker: HUME
text_entry: Ay, what else? fear you not her courage.

speaker: BOLINGBROKE
text_entry: I have heard her reported to be a woman of an

speaker: BOLINGBROKE
text_entry: invincible spirit: but it shall be convenient,

speaker: BOLINGBROKE
text_entry: Master Hume, that you be by her aloft, while we be

speaker: BOLINGBROKE
text_entry: busy below; and so, I pray you, go, in Gods name,

speaker: BOLINGBROKE
text_entry: and leave us.

speaker: BOLINGBROKE
text_entry: Exit HUME

speaker: BOLINGBROKE
text_entry: Mother Jourdain, be you

speaker: BOLINGBROKE
text_entry: prostrate and grovel on the earth; John Southwell,

speaker: BOLINGBROKE
text_entry: read you; and let us to our work.

speaker: BOLINGBROKE
text_entry: Enter the DUCHESS aloft, HUME following

speaker: DUCHESS
text_entry: Well said, my masters; and welcome all. To this

speaker: DUCHESS
text_entry: gear the sooner the better.

speaker: BOLINGBROKE
text_entry: Patience, good lady; wizards know their times:

speaker: BOLINGBROKE
text_entry: Deep night, dark night, the silent of the night,

speaker: BOLINGBROKE
text_entry: The time of night when Troy was set on fire;

speaker: BOLINGBROKE
text_entry: The time when screech-owls cry and ban-dogs howl,

speaker: BOLINGBROKE
text_entry: And spirits walk and ghosts break up their graves,

speaker: BOLINGBROKE
text_entry: That time best fits the work we have in hand.

speaker: BOLINGBROKE
text_entry: Madam, sit you and fear not: whom we raise,

speaker: BOLINGBROKE
text_entry: We will make fast within a hallowd verge.

speaker: BOLINGBROKE
text_entry: Here they do the ceremonies belonging, and make the  circle; BOLINGBROKE or SOUTHWELL reads, Conjuro te, and c. It thunders and lightens terribly; then the Spirit riseth

text_entry: Adsum.

speaker: MARGARET JOURDAIN
text_entry: Asmath,

speaker: MARGARET JOURDAIN
text_entry: By the eternal God, whose name and power

speaker: MARGARET JOURDAIN
text_entry: Thou tremblest at, answer that I shall ask;

speaker: MARGARET JOURDAIN
text_entry: For, till thou speak, thou shalt not pass from hence.

speaker: Spirit
text_entry: Ask what thou wilt. That I had said and done!

speaker: BOLINGBROKE
text_entry: First of the king: what shall of him become?

text_entry: Reading out of a paper

text_entry: The duke yet lives that Henry shall depose;

speaker: Spirit
text_entry: But him outlive, and die a violent death.

text_entry: As the Spirit speaks, SOUTHWELL writes the answer

speaker: BOLINGBROKE
text_entry: What fates await the Duke of Suffolk?

speaker: Spirit
text_entry: By water shall he die, and take his end.

speaker: BOLINGBROKE
text_entry: What shall befall the Duke of Somerset?

speaker: Spirit
text_entry: Let him shun castles;

speaker: Spirit
text_entry: Safer shall he be upon the sandy plains

speaker: Spirit
text_entry: Than where castles mounted stand.

speaker: Spirit
text_entry: Have done, for more I hardly can endure.

speaker: BOLINGBROKE
text_entry: Descend to darkness and the burning lake!

speaker: BOLINGBROKE
text_entry: False fiend, avoid!

speaker: BOLINGBROKE
text_entry: Thunder and lightning. Exit Spirit

speaker: BOLINGBROKE
text_entry: Enter YORK and BUCKINGHAM with their Guard and break in

text_entry: Lay hands upon these traitors and their trash.

text_entry: Beldam, I think we watchd you at an inch.

speaker: YORK
text_entry: What, madam, are you there? the king and commonweal

speaker: YORK
text_entry: Are deeply indebted for this piece of pains:

speaker: YORK
text_entry: My lord protector will, I doubt it not,

speaker: YORK
text_entry: See you well guerdond for these good deserts.

text_entry: Not half so bad as thine to Englands king,

speaker: DUCHESS
text_entry: Injurious duke, that threatest wheres no cause.

speaker: BUCKINGHAM
text_entry: True, madam, none at all: what call you this?

speaker: BUCKINGHAM
text_entry: Away with them! let them be clappd up close.

speaker: BUCKINGHAM
text_entry: And kept asunder. You, madam, shall with us.

speaker: BUCKINGHAM
text_entry: Stafford, take her to thee.

speaker: BUCKINGHAM
text_entry: Exeunt above DUCHESS and HUME, guarded

speaker: BUCKINGHAM
text_entry: Well see your trinkets here all forthcoming.

speaker: BUCKINGHAM

text_entry: Lord Buckingham, methinks, you watchd her well:

speaker: YORK
text_entry: A pretty plot, well chosen to build upon!

speaker: YORK

speaker: YORK
text_entry: What have we here?

speaker: YORK
text_entry: Reads

speaker: YORK
text_entry: The duke yet lives, that Henry shall depose;

speaker: YORK

text_entry: Why, this is just

speaker: YORK
text_entry: Well, to the rest:

speaker: YORK

text_entry: These oracles are hardly attaind,

text_entry: With him the husband of this lovely lady:
